info.description: The Payroll service enables you to access and manage payroll information, such as pay groups, payroll inputs, and tax rates.
info.title: payroll

tags.name: minimumWageRates
tags.description: Provides the ability to view federal, state, and local minimum wage rates.

tags.name: payGroupDetails
tags.description: Provides the ability to view pay group details. Inactive and External Pay Group Details are not supported.

tags.name: payGroups
tags.description: Provides the ability to view pay groups. Inactive and External Pay Groups are not supported.

tags.name: payrollInputs
tags.description: Provides the ability to get, add, update, and delete payroll inputs for workers and pay components. These REST APIs: * Are secured to the Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) and Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domains. * The POST, PATCH, DELETE methods for self-service users require Pay Component Security Segments. Self-service users can view their own Payroll Inputs using GET without a Pay Component Security Segment. * Pay Component Segment Security is only supported on the Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security Group must use a Self-Service – Worker security group type as the basis. * Don't support Payroll Tax Location Mapping or Pay Components that require Special Entry.

tags.name: taxRates
tags.description: Use these REST APIs to access company SUI tax rates.

tags.name: Prompt Values
tags.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service.

get.summary: Retrieves a single pay group instance.
get.description: Retrieves a pay group instance with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves the pay group for a specified job ID. This method always returns 1 pay group.
get.description: Retrieves the pay group for a specified job ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: effective
parameters.description: The effective date of the pay group, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single pay group instance.
get.description: Retrieves a pay group with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a collection of jobs. Secured by: Worker Position: View Scope: Staffing

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of minimum wage rates.
get.description: Retrieves all minimum wage rates. A query parameter specifying either a country or a tax authority is required to retrieve the data. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll (Minimum Wages View) - CAN, Set Up: Payroll (Minimum Wages View) - USA, Set Up: Payroll Authority Minimum Wages View (Compensation functional area), svc-paycomply-tool Service Scope: CAN Payroll, Core Compensation, USA Payroll

parameters.name: asOfDate
parameters.description: The minimum wage rates that are effective on the date specified using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

parameters.name: includeLocalTaxAuthorities
parameters.description: If true, returns minimum wage rates for local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state rates. If false (default), only returns federal and state minimum wage rates.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: taxAuthority
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the payroll tax authority for the minimum wages rates. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/taxAuthorities. You can specify 1 or more tax authority query parameters. Example: taxAuthority=taxAuthority1&taxAuthority=taxAuthority2.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single payroll input instance.
get.description: Retrieves a payroll input with the specified ID. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type.
A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags].
A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date.
A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc].
A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats]
A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker].
A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags].
A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type.
A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc].
A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country.
A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row.
A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc].
A552 | Specify a Start Date.
A555 | Specify a Pay Component.
A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input.
A560 | Specify a position for [pc].
A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase]

delete.summary: Deletes an existing payroll input instance.
delete.description: Deletes an existing payroll input instance with the specified ID. The Pay Component Segment Security configuration is required. Note that Pay Component Segment Security is supported only on the Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security Group must use a Self-Service – Worker security group type as the basis. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type.
A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags].
A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date.
A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc].
A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats]
A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker].
A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags].
A140 | You can't delete this input. It's used in an on-cycle result of a locked pay group or a completed pay result.
A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type.
A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc].
A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country.
A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row.
A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc].
A552 | Specify a Start Date.
A554 | You can't delete a payroll input that's used in an off-cycle payment.
A555 | Specify a Pay Component.
A556 | You can't delete an external payroll input.
A558 | You can't delete a payroll input that's used in a completed or suspended retro result.
A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input.
A560 | Specify a position for [pc].
A561 | [pc] isn't configured for self-service. You can't delete your own payroll input.
A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase]

patch.summary: Partially updates an existing payroll input instance.
patch.description: Partially updates an existing payroll input instance with the specified ID and the specified data in the request body. Before calling this PATCH method, call the GET /payrollInputs method to retrieve the current payroll input information. You cannot update the worker field with this PATCH method. The Pay Component Segment Security configuration is required. Note that Pay Component Segment Security is supported only on the Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security Group must use a Self-Service – Worker security group type as the basis. **Starting in v2:** The fieldEditability field in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determines the fields that you can update with the PATCH /payrollInputs method. Possible fieldEditability values: * all - All fields can be updated, except the worker field. * none - No fields can be updated. * endDateOnly - Only the endDate field can be updated. ** In v1: ** The lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult fields in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determine the fields you can update with this PATCH method: * If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult are both false, all fields can be updated, except the worker field. * If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult are both true, no fields can be updated. * If only usedInCompletedResult is true, only the endDate field can be updated. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)

A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags].
A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date.
A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc].
A121 | Enter a date that's latest between the completed pay period end date and the locked result period end date for the appropriate run category.
A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats]
A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker].
A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags].
A140 | You can't edit any fields on this input. It's used in an on-cycle result of a locked pay group, a completed pay result, or a retro result.
A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type.
A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc].
A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country.
A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row.
A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc].
A552 | Specify a Start Date.
A553 | You can edit only the end date. This pay input is used in an on-cycle result of a locked pay group or a completed pay result.
A554 | You can't update a payroll input that's used in an off-cycle payment.
A555 | Specify a Pay Component.
A556 | You can't update an external payroll input.
A557 | You can't edit any fields on this input. It's used in an on-cycle result of a locked pay group, a completed pay result, or a retro result.
A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input.
A560 | Specify a position for [pc].
A561 | [pc] isn't configured for self-service. You can't update your own payroll input.
A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase]
A994 | You can only update this payroll input with the payroll input lines that are associated with it. Change these payroll input lines: [input line IDs]

get.description: Retrieves a list of tax authorities available for use as query parameters in the /minimumWageRates endpoint. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll (Minimum Wages View) - CAN, Set Up: Payroll (Minimum Wages View) - USA, Set Up: Payroll Authority Minimum Wages View (Compensation functional area) Scope: CAN Payroll, Core Compensation, USA Payroll

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country for the tax authorities. You can use a returned id from GET /values/minimumWageRatesGroup/countries. You can specify 1 country query parameter. Example: country=country.

parameters.name: includeLocalTaxAuthorities
parameters.description: If true, returns local tax authorities, such as cities and counties, in addition to federal and state tax authorities. If false (default), only returns federal and state tax authorities.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of payroll inputs. At least 1 query parameter is required to get data.
get.description: Retrieves all payroll inputs. At least 1 query parameter is required to get data. The Pay Component Segment Security configuration doesn't apply to the GET method. Self-service users can view all of their own Payroll Inputs. **Starting in v2:** The fieldEditability field in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determines the fields that you can update with the PATCH /payrollInputs method. Possible fieldEditability values: * all - All fields can be updated, except the worker field. * none - No fields can be updated. * endDateOnly - Only the endDate field can be updated. ** In v1: ** The lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult fields in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determine the fields that you can update with the PATCH /payrollInputs method. * If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult are both false, all fields can be updated, except the worker field. * If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult are both true, no fields can be updated. * If only usedInCompletedResult is true, only the endDate field can be updated. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or before the end date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: payComponent
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the pay component for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or after the start date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of worker for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type.
A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags].
A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date.
A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc].
A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats]
A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker].
A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags].
A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type.
A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc].
A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country.
A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row.
A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc].
A552 | Specify a Start Date.
A555 | Specify a Pay Component.
A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input.
A560 | Specify a position for [pc].
A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase]

post.description: Creates a single payroll input instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: worker, payComponent and startDate. * If you specified a position-based payComponent, then the position field is required. * If a worktag applies to the payComponent, provide a valid worktag. * If ongoing is false, then an endDate is required for a one-time payroll input. * If you specified inputDetails, then the type field is required. The Pay Component Segment Security configuration is required. Note that Pay Component Segment Security is supported only on the Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security Group must use a Self-Service – Worker security group type as the basis. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type.
A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags].
A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date.
A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc].
A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats]
A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker].
A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags].
A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type.
A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc].
A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country.
A549 | Specify a Worker.
A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row.
A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc].
A552 | Specify a Start Date.
A555 | Specify a Pay Component.
A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input.
A560 | Specify a position for [pc].
A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase]

parameters.name: country

get.summary: Retrieves a single or a collection of company SUI rates.
get.description: Retrieves all company SUI rates. You can filter the company SUI rates by company, payroll state authority tax code, or effective date. Secured by: Process: Tax Filing/W-2s (Run) - USA Scope: USA Payroll

parameters.name: company
parameters.description: The company reference ID or WID that represents 1 or more companies. Example: company=comp1&company=comp2&company=cb550da820584750aae8f807882fa79a

parameters.name: effective
parameters.description: The effective date for the SUI rate, using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: payrollStateAuthorityTaxCode
parameters.description: The FIPS code or WID that represents 1 or more states. Example: payrollStateAuthorityTaxCode=06&payrollStateAuthorityTaxCode=3b3d378d5f4a48b8b3ac46fee0703226&payrollStateAuthorityTaxCode=48

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates a single or a collection of Company SUI Rates.
post.description: Creates a single or a collection of company SUI rates. To create a single company SUI rate, specify the single JSON object in the request body. To create multiple company SUI rates, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter. You must specify the JSON object collection in data[ ] in the request body. The maximum collection size is 100. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: companyInstance, stateInstance, taxCode, startDate. Secured by: Process: Tax Filing/W-2s (Run) - USA Scope: USA Payroll

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A5 | Enter a U.S. State that's not Guam. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A5 | Enter a U.S. company with a U.S. Tax ID. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A12 | Enter an Applicable Rate that's less than 10, contains up to 6 decimal places, and is a positive number. Example: 9.999999. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A12 | Enter an Employer Identification Number that's valid, and isn't null or 'null'. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A12 | You must enter exactly 'W_SUIER' as the taxCode. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A119 | Enter an End Date that's after or on the Start Date. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A121 | Enter an End Date that's not between the start and end dates of another row. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])
A124 | Enter a Start Date that's not between the start and end dates of an existing row. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start])

get.description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. Secured by: Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: payComponent
parameters.description: The pay component for the worktags. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of pay groups.
get.description: Retrieves all pay groups. Inactive and External Pay Groups are not supported. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the country or territory of the pay group. You can use a returned country id from any of the payGroups endpoints in this Payroll API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

id.description: Workday Id or Reference Id of the instance.

descriptor.description: The display name of the instance

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

descriptor.description: A description of the facet

If the position is not effective, no value will be returned. Primary and additional job are effective dated due to the Switch Primary Job business process. An international assignment cannot be switched to a be a primary job.
